chapter.title: An Introduction to TestLink
chapter.para: TestLink is an open source test management tool written in PHP. In order to install TestLink you will need a Apache or similar http server with PHP 5 and a database. The databases currently supported by TestLink out of the box are MySQL, Postgre SQL and MS SQL, although there are users that managed to use Oracle too. You can download it from http://www.teamst.org.

In TestLink you have, among other features, Test Plans, Requirement management, Baselines, Custom Fields, Test Suite with Test Cases and Reporting. For external access, there is a XML-RPC API available (it is not enabled by default). Other two nice features in TestLink are the versioning of the some entities, like Test Case and Requirements, and the ability to import and export your testing data in different file formats.

There are bindings for the TestLink XML-RPC API available for other languages such as Ruby and Java. The Jenkins and TestLink integration is done using TestLink Java API - http://testlinkjavaapi.sourceforge.net.

At the moment that this guide is being written the latest stable version of TestLink is 1.9.2, however versions 1.9.3 and 2.0 are already planned and scheduled. While the Jenkins version is not a compatibility issue for this integration, the same cannot be said about TestLink. This guide is intended for Testlink 1.9.2. In case there are other versions available at the moment that you are reading this guide, you may find issues during your Jenkins Job execution. There is a compatibility table available in the plug-in Wiki.
